headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MICHEL, ERNEST W

snippet: MICHEL--Ernest W. Selfhelp Community Services deeply mourns the passing of Ernest Michel, an extraordinary leader, visionary and tireless advocate for the needs of Holocaust survivors. Having lived through the terrors of the Holocaust, Ernie emerged to dedicate his life to serving the Jewish community. His work at the helm of UJA-Federation of New York was legendary and he was a steadfast friend and supporter of Selfhelp. As the largest provider of comprehensive services to Holocaust survivors in North America, Selfhelp's founders pledged to serve as the last surviving relative to victims of Nazi persecution. Ernie Michel exemplified this promise. He will be profoundly missed. We extend sincerest heartfelt condolences to Ernie's wife, Amy Goldberg Michel, his children, grandchildren, and the entire family. Raymond V.J. Schrag, President Stuart C. Kaplan, CEO 1/3
